Class Card

java.lang.Object
  Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

This class represents a standard playing card.

Constructor Detail

Card

public Card()
Default constructor to create the Ace of Spades.

Card

public Card(int cardNum)
Constructor to create a specific card in a 52 card deck. Passing in 1 to 13 will create a Spade, 14 to 26 will create a Heart, etc.

Method Detail

getFaceInt

public int getFaceInt()
Converts the String face value to the corresponding integer (i.e. "Ace" = 1, "Jack" = 11, etc.).

getSuitInt

public int getSuitInt()
Converts the String suit to a corresponding integer (i.e. "Spades" = 1, etc.).

getSuit

public java.lang.String getSuit()
Returns the suit.

getFace

public java.lang.String getFace()
Returns the face.

compareTo

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object other)
Compares two Cards. The comparison is made by face first, then by suit. Cards will be sorted with Aces first (order Spades, Hearts, Clubs, Diamonds), then 2s, etc.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 int x,
                 int y)
Draw the image associated with this Card to the screen.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Reports the card face and value.
